title: Announcing the 2025 Bespoked Manchester Apocalypse Build-Off
content:
Welcome to the first-ever BESPOKED Apocalypse Build-Off, that’s not only for framebuilders but also open to independent bike shops and individuals. Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, is to build a bike for the apocalypse…

Portus Cycles BESPOKED 2018 Photographer – Ben Broomfield

It’s easy to lose sight of the fact that building bikes can be a fun, creative process. Very few exhibitors at the show started out making super high-end dream bikes. For the vast majority, there has been significant time spent learning their skill sets—tinkering in the basement, back room of a bike shop, garage, or even a kitchen— making things work and assembling parts against their will to create a personal bike or one for a friend that just works really well. A zero- pressure build that’s just for fun.

BESPOKED is designed to showcase the very best work to a growing international audience. The BESPOKED Apocalypse Build-Off, however, is an invitation to play—to reconnect with a special kind of creativity that thrives within the confines of limitations. A space where, within those limitations, you can be freaks and just have fun.

For the cost of 10 weekend passes to the show, we’re offering independent bike shops a pre-built, branded plinth and bike stand on the viewing platform of the main hall at Victoria Baths, as well as 10 tickets to the show to give to customers and staff—to come and support you and hang out for a fun weekend that genuinely celebrates makers and cycling culture.

Leafcycles BESPOKED Dresden 2023, Photographer – Adam Gasson

The Build-Off is also open to exhibitors at the show, who will be offered a plinth and free entry into the competition. All you have to do is let us know. You’ll be entering the Apocalypse Build-Off form through BESPOKED’s online form! Space is limited and will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

The Build-Off Project Must Have:

  • Wheels
  • Brakes
  • Saddle
  • Steering
  • Drivetrain
  • Something to carry luggage
  • Anti-theft system
  • Sleeping system
  • Tools/repair kit
  • Tools to make fire (lighter/matches = 0 points; +1 if no lighter or matches)
  • Something cut wood
  • Some empty storage for food/ surprise finds +1 per 50l
  • A shelter
  • Cooking equipment (must be able to boil water) + a cooked one-person meal

Each builder must have a printed and bound build document outlining design theory/ considerations, parts used, the cost of each part, and the total cost/ weight of the bike with/without luggage.

When you enter the Build-Off, you will be given a PDF from BESPOKED outlining the project in its entirety with points breakdown, rules, etc.

Sign up for BESPOKED Manchester today! See you there!
